com.mesosphere.sdk.offer.constrain

Interface PlacementRule

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AgentRule, AndRule, AttributeRule, HostnameRule, MaxPerAttributeRule, MaxPerHostnameRule, NotRule, OrRule, PassthroughRule, RoundRobinByAttributeRule, RoundRobinByHostnameRule, TaskTypeRule

    public interface PlacementRule
    Implements placement constraint logic on an offer, filtering out the Resources which are not to be used according to the filter logic. Accepts an Offer and returns a copy of that Offer with any disallowed Resources filtered out, or may return the original Offer without copying if everything passes the filter. If the entire Offer is rejected, the return value will be a non-null Offer with zero Resources. PlacementRules may contain multiple internal checks, and may even be a composition of other PlacementRules.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Must be explicitly implemented by all PlacementRules.
      Offer filter(Offer offer, OfferRequirement offerRequirement, java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
      Returns a copy of that Offer with any disallowed Resources filtered out, or may return the original Offer without copying if everything passes the filter.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        Offer filter(Offer offer,
             OfferRequirement offerRequirement,
             java.util.Collection<TaskInfo> tasks)
        Returns a copy of that Offer with any disallowed Resources filtered out, or may return the original Offer without copying if everything passes the filter. If the entire Offer is rejected, the return value will be a non-null Offer with zero Resources.
        Parameters:
        offer - the offer to be examined
        offerRequirement - the offer requirement describing what's to be done with this offer
        tasks - the currently deployed tasks in the system, possibly including a duplicate of the task being launched as represented in the offerRequirement. Use PlacementUtils.areEquivalent(TaskInfo, OfferRequirement) to detect duplicates
        Returns:
        either the uncopied input as-is, or a copy of the input with zero or more Resources stripped out

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Must be explicitly implemented by all PlacementRules.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        TaskUtils.areDifferent( com.mesosphere.sdk.specification.TaskSpec, com.mesosphere.sdk.specification.TaskSpec)
